summary: Sometimes I think about Cersei’s stance of ‘You and I are the only people in the world’, ‘Everyone who isn’t us is the enemy’,...
body:
Sometimes I think about Cersei’s stance of ‘You and I are the only people in the world’, ‘Everyone who isn’t us is the enemy’, ‘We’re the only ones who matter’.

Against Daenerys and Jon’s genuine care for…everyone. 

One is a toxic romance that would harm the world to save themselves.

The other is romance in which they would harm themselves to save the world.

Of course Jamie has progressed from this mindset quite a bit.

reblog.comment:

The other is romance in which they would harm themselves to save the world.

Of course Jamie has progressed from this mindset quite a bit.

blog.name: faramir-boromir
blog.title: rebellions are built on hope
blog.description: I do not love the bright sword for its sharpness, nor the arrow for its swiftness, nor the warrior for his glory. I love only that which they defend.

tags: the game of thrones doesnt matter
body:
The Reach as a Microcosm

Since the argument over the Tarlys and Daenerys in the show is down to the usual bleating about the usual nonsense, I wanna talk about how it’s going to play out (in my opinion, of course) in the last two books.

Let’s set the scene as ADwD ends: Mace is outside KL with a large host that include Randyll Tarly. The Faith has Margaery inside the city. Coming up from tha Stormlands is fAegon. In the Reach we have Euron invading and, uh, preparing to summon a giant fucking squid to destroy Oldtown. His main opponents there are Mace’s two oldest sons: Wyllis and Garlan who are gathering forces to oppose Euron.

House Tyrell is in a VERY precarious situation. It’s one that Randyll is going to take advantage of. He’s going to betray Mace, probably to the poor fool’s death. Randyll is fAegon’s “friend in the Reach”. We know from Dany’s HoTU that fAegon will take KL. He will get help from Randyll. In return, Randyll will be named Lord Paramount of the Reach. An immensely powerful position.

Here’s the problem: Randyll is in KL (and good luck with that when Dany comes, jackass). The Reach is about to get swamped by Euron’s apocalyptic nightmare. While Randyll is backstabbing (perhaps literally with Mace) and plotting in the capitol, the area he’s going to be in charge of protecting is in dire fucking straits.

Wyllis and Garlan, who have now no doubt been stripped of significant power by fAegon, ARE, unlike Randyll, still in the Reach. While Randyll Tarly plays the game of thrones, the men he’s deposing ARENT. They are literally fighting an apocalypse on the ground.

Imagine the scene when they have all the Lords in the Reach around them for a battle planning session and they get the Raven from KL that says they’re not in charge. What do you think the response from all those Lords will be? I’m sure there’s an idiot or two (and make no mistake, they’re idiots) who will leave. Fools who will take seriously the commands of a King hundreds of miles away rather than stay and fight the nightmare in front of them. But damn near all of them will recognize the truth: it doesn’t matter what you call Wyllis or Garlan, what matters is that they’re FIGHTING and theyre LEADING. So they’re all gonna stick with the Tyrell’s and fight the apocalypse. They might even laugh and chuckle and toss the scroll in the flames.

In the end, the politics DO NOT MATTER. All that matters is the fight. That’s why the Reach is a microcosm for the Realm as a whole. When the even scarier apocalypse comes in from the North, the politics wont matter. All that matters is who’s leading the fight and how they’re doing at that job.

Again, that doesn’t mean that there won’t be a few exceptions. A few people seeking to use the fight to grab more power. Of course there will be. Human nature is still human nature. But the people willing to fight and keep fighting: for the realm, for their home, for their people, for each other; they’re the ones that will have the REAL power.

Wyllis and Garlan will help beat back Euron. Daenerys is undoubtedly going to be a big help (there’s a reason Loras is on Dragonstone) when she gets there. Especially if Euron has stolen a dragon. That’s going to make the fight personal for her. Euron’s Eldritch Apocalypse (tm @poorquentyn) will melt under dragonfire and the leadership skills of the Tyrells. The squid will (poor baby it deserved so much better) be roasted alive. A feast for dragons and men alike.

All the while the man nominally in charge of the region will be absent and then likely dead. His titles meant nothing. Because most of them do. The only thing that matters is the fight. Against the multiple apocalypses coming.

Edit: Since this thought has been half formed for a while I just thought of this: Randyll will be unable to even defend his own home. I’d love it if Garlan led a defense of Horn Hill. Because they’re his people. And they’re in danger. A perfect example of my point.

body:
First Line Meme

I was tagged by the lovely @drakhus and @notpmahalem — thanks you two!! I’ve really enjoyed reading all the openings over the past few days. Such creativity!! As I only have 3 Jonerys fics, you can find their openings below, along with a bonus for how Birthright will most likely open (still very much a WIP and subject to change, of course). Everything is linked, so if you see something you like, follow the link to the fics on Ao3!

Snowstorm - on Ice!

“Men’s Final: Group 4 to the ice, please. Men’s Final: Group 4 to the ice please.” the pleasant, disembodied voice of the announcer sounded over the loudspeaker system, a startling opposite to the heavy backstage atmosphere that surged to immediate cacophony as the final group of skaters lurched to their feet as one. Coaches, choreographers, competitors and the like all now brimming with last minute advice, well wishes, and in the instance of one unfortunate skater from the tiny country of Volantis, vomit.

Nerves. They were everywhere. You could trip on them like a livewire and watch your dreams die before you even had time to draw your next breath. But then again, this was the Olympic Games. One could hardly expect anything to be easy when the entire world was watching, especially with a gold medal on the line.

Jon Snow lifted his head from where it had been lightly resting in his hands, reflexively reaching to toss his wayward curls out of his eyes before realizing that his hair was secured in a half bun. He tightened the laces to his ice skates once more for luck, and took his place in line among the other skaters as the final group was called to the ice.

“Snow.” he turned as the voice of their– his, his coach, Tyrion Lannister sounded in his ears, and lifted an eyebrow. “Breathe.” Tyrion continued. “It’s just the warm-up. The hard part comes later.”

Just Once

As Drogon falls from the sky, the white winds howl– an eerie specter given voice that will haunt him until the last. An unhinged titter drops from his lips, tightly stretched over his teeth in a snarl, and Jon cannot help but pray to the old gods that she be spared just once. Just this once.

Wolves of Stone

She could not go to the Godswood - the gods of the North did not belong to her, and she would not dishonor them in such a way, even if she did believe in them. Besides, he would be there. He had spoken fondly of the heated pools and the massive weirwood with its savage, carved face during their time together on her ship. A lifetime ago. She would not begrudge him of all that he held sacred.

Instead, she found her feet following a queer path– one of sadness and death. The crypt seemed to materialize before her eyes, dank, and sour, and cool– hidden under the ground where the Kings of Winter sat their thrones for all eternity.

Or until the dead came for them all.

Birthright

White.

For as far as his eyes can see, all that remains of his world, is white.

Winterfell was falling.

~*~*~*~*~*~

As we can all see, I tend to jump right into the action, lol. I think everyone has been tagged, but if you see this and want to do it, have at it!

As Drogon falls from the sky, the white winds howl– an eerie specter given voice that will haunt him until the last. An unhinged titter drops from his lips, tightly stretched over his teeth in a snarl, and Jon cannot help but pray to the old gods that she be spared just once. Just this once.

Wolves of Stone

She could not go to the Godswood - the gods of the North did not belong to her, and she would not dishonor them in such a way, even if she did believe in them. Besides, he would be there. He had spoken fondly of the heated pools and the massive weirwood with its savage, carved face during their time together on her ship. A lifetime ago. She would not begrudge him of all that he held sacred.

Instead, she found her feet following a queer path– one of sadness and death. The crypt seemed to materialize before her eyes, dank, and sour, and cool– hidden under the ground where the Kings of Winter sat their thrones for all eternity.

Or until the dead came for them all.

Birthright

White.

For as far as his eyes can see, all that remains of his world, is white.

Winterfell was falling.

~*~*~*~*~*~

As we can all see, I tend to jump right into the action, lol. I think everyone has been tagged, but if you see this and want to do it, have at it!
trail.content:
First Line Meme

I was tagged by the lovely @drakhus and @notpmahalem — thanks you two!! I’ve really enjoyed reading all the openings over the past few days. Such creativity!! As I only have 3 Jonerys fics, you can find their openings below, along with a bonus for how Birthright will most likely open (still very much a WIP and subject to change, of course). Everything is linked, so if you see something you like, follow the link to the fics on Ao3!

Snowstorm - on Ice!

“Men’s Final: Group 4 to the ice, please. Men’s Final: Group 4 to the ice please.” the pleasant, disembodied voice of the announcer sounded over the loudspeaker system, a startling opposite to the heavy backstage atmosphere that surged to immediate cacophony as the final group of skaters lurched to their feet as one. Coaches, choreographers, competitors and the like all now brimming with last minute advice, well wishes, and in the instance of one unfortunate skater from the tiny country of Volantis, vomit.

Nerves. They were everywhere. You could trip on them like a livewire and watch your dreams die before you even had time to draw your next breath. But then again, this was the Olympic Games. One could hardly expect anything to be easy when the entire world was watching, especially with a gold medal on the line.

Jon Snow lifted his head from where it had been lightly resting in his hands, reflexively reaching to toss his wayward curls out of his eyes before realizing that his hair was secured in a half bun. He tightened the laces to his ice skates once more for luck, and took his place in line among the other skaters as the final group was called to the ice.

“Snow.” he turned as the voice of their– his, his coach, Tyrion Lannister sounded in his ears, and lifted an eyebrow. “Breathe.” Tyrion continued. “It’s just the warm-up. The hard part comes later.”

Just Once

As Drogon falls from the sky, the white winds howl– an eerie specter given voice that will haunt him until the last. An unhinged titter drops from his lips, tightly stretched over his teeth in a snarl, and Jon cannot help but pray to the old gods that she be spared just once. Just this once.

Wolves of Stone

She could not go to the Godswood - the gods of the North did not belong to her, and she would not dishonor them in such a way, even if she did believe in them. Besides, he would be there. He had spoken fondly of the heated pools and the massive weirwood with its savage, carved face during their time together on her ship. A lifetime ago. She would not begrudge him of all that he held sacred.

Instead, she found her feet following a queer path– one of sadness and death. The crypt seemed to materialize before her eyes, dank, and sour, and cool– hidden under the ground where the Kings of Winter sat their thrones for all eternity.

Or until the dead came for them all.

Birthright

White.

For as far as his eyes can see, all that remains of his world, is white.

Winterfell was falling.

~*~*~*~*~*~

As we can all see, I tend to jump right into the action, lol. I think everyone has been tagged, but if you see this and want to do it, have at it!

summary: Sansa: Jon, how do I get revenge on my enemies? Jon: The best revenge is letting go and living well Sansa:... Sansa: Arya, how...
body:
Sansa: Jon, how do I get revenge on my enemies?

Jon: The best revenge is letting go and living well

Sansa:…

Sansa: Arya, how do I get–

Arya: I’m already packed. Let’s go.


Inspired by this post: http://readasaur.tumblr.com/post/178360870296/katara-aang-how-do-i-get-revenge-on-those-who

title: Chapter-by-Chapter Analysis: Jon IV, ASOS
body:
Chapter-by-Chapter Analysis: Jon IV, ASOS

“In the Seven Kingdoms it was said that the Wall marked the end of the world. That is true for them as well. It was all in where you stood.”

Synopsis: Jon Snow and Ygritte climb the Wall.

SPOILER WARNING: This chapter analysis, and all following, will contain spoilers for all Song of Ice and Fire novels and Game of Thrones episodes. Caveat lector.

(more…)

summary: I'm honestly so hyped for the Arya X Jon X Bran family reunion more then anything 👏🏾♥️
body:
I’m honestly so hyped for the Arya X Jon X Bran family reunion more then anything 👏🏾♥️

(no shade) but they never treated Jon like an outcast and a outsider like some people (👀). They really looked up to my BOI and loved him dearly. 💖💖 It’s gonna seriously DESTROY ME when they all run up and hug one another 😂 in s8

Who knows? maybe homeboi bran might magically walk again just to get up and hug Jon. 😂 or even crack a smile lmao.

Anything can happen 😁
